message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.DB 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it deals with recommender systems which are a type of information filtering technology. It could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it proposes a method to improve the performance of recommender systems. The paper also involves Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) as it uses named entities and domain terms to construct topic hierarchies. Additionally, it could belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category as recommender systems are often used in social networks. Finally, it could belong to the Databases (cs.DB) sub-category as recommender systems involve managing and processing large amounts of data.
